snippet: The police shooting of Michael Brown, a Missouri teenager, has prompted a social media campaign over negative depictions of young black men in the news media.
abstract: Speed with which shooting of teenager Michael Brown by police in Ferguson, Mo, has resonated on social media has helped propel and transform a local police-involved shooting into a national cause; African-American commenters are drawing attention to continued episodes of violence directed at blacks and at how media portrays young black men with negative stereotypes.

byline.contributor: Samantha Storey and Alan Blinder contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The police shooting of Michael Brown, a Missouri teenager, has prompted a social media campaign over negative depictions of young black men in the news media.

headline.main: Shooting Spurs Hashtag Effort on Stereotypes
headline.print_headline: Shooting Spurs Hashtag Effort on Stereotypes
